SMART  I absolutely agree with the "Green flags" to look for in selecting courses namely, social proof, clear curriculum, upfront pricing, and refund policy.  First off, verifying social proof is important as it allows individuals to gauge the experiences of past students and their satisfaction with the course. This helps ensure that one is investing time and money in a reputable and effective learning opportunity. Moreover, clear curriculum ensures that the course covers the specific topics and skills one is interested in, aligning with their learning goals. Lastly, upfront pricing and a transparent refund policy are crucial factors to consider, as they provide financial security and confidence in one's investment, ensuring that one has a recourse if the course fails to meet one's expectations or circumstances change.
